title: Redesign main page with hero section and editable flight status indicator

requirements.text: Redesign the main page hero section to match the uploaded reference images (image-1.png, image-2.png) with a prominent 'Where can we take you?' headline centered over the background image

quotes: make the main page look like that but with the text you need to have

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section displays 'Where can we take you?' as the main headline
Layout matches the visual structure shown in the uploaded reference images
Background image is visible behind the hero content
Text is clearly legible with appropriate contrast

requirements.text: Add a flight status indicator to the main page that displays the current operational status (e.g., 'On Time', 'Delayed', 'Cancelled') prominently in the hero or header area

quotes: make it where its saying on time or what ever

acceptanceCriteria: Status indicator is visible on the main page
Displays current operational status text (e.g., 'On Time', 'Delayed')
Status updates dynamically based on backend data
Visual design integrates with glassmorphism theme

requirements.text: Add a FlightStatus type to the backend with fields for status text and timestamp, and implement functions to set and retrieve the current flight status

quotes: staff can edit in admin if its on time or no

acceptanceCriteria: FlightStatus type defined in backend/main.mo
setFlightStatus function allows updating the status
getFlightStatus function returns the current status
Status persists across canister upgrades

requirements.text: Add flight status editing controls to the admin dashboard at /admin-ops allowing staff to select and update the operational status (On Time, Delayed, Cancelled, etc.)

quotes: staff can edit in admin if its on time or no

acceptanceCriteria: Status editor appears in the admin dashboard
Dropdown or radio buttons allow selecting status options
Save button triggers backend update
Success confirmation displays after update
Current status is pre-selected when page loads

requirements.text: Connect the main page flight status indicator to the backend getFlightStatus query and refresh status automatically using React Query
acceptanceCriteria: Status indicator fetches data from backend on load
React Query refetchInterval keeps status current
Status updates reflect immediately after admin changes
Loading and error states are handled gracefully

constraints: Do not modify frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts
Maintain the existing glassmorphism design system with Air Canada red accent colors
Preserve the existing admin password authentication flow
nonGoals: Changing the existing departures page or booking flow
Adding real-time WebSocket updates for status changes
